column4: Filesystem on an ever increasing pool of disks: XFS/ext and symlink, ZFS? Other suggestions? I won't JBOD raid them because I don't want to lose everything if one dies.
Is xfs as stable as ext? Is the journaliing as good? Is there any reason I should choose one over the other (avg filesize will be 200mb
I believe xfs is more likely to zero out files if your system unexpectedly loses power. (Pretty much any filesystem but ext2/3/4 will do that)
No, as in "The file was being modified when the power failed. It's not the old or the new version or even a mix of them... it's just zero-byte file now."
